## getClosest() function

Traverse the element (unless skipped) and its parents until an element is found that matches the selectors.

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare function getClosest<T extends Element>(element: Element, selectors: string, skipSelf?: boolean): null | T;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

element


</td><td>

Element


</td><td>

The element from which to search.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

selectors


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

One or more selectors to match.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

skipSelf


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Ignore `element` and begin the search on its parent.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

null \| T

## Example 1

Traverse the element and its parents until a match is found.

```ts
const element = closest('.foo');
```

## Example 2

Traverse the element's parents only, until a match is found.

```ts
const element = closest('.foo', true);
```
